_header: Three things me cometh a day
Subjects: three sorrowful things; sermons, verse in

OxfLinLat129.Transcription:
Thre thyngys me comyth a dayWherefore y sorow & wel y
                    mayThat on ys þat y schal henneThat oþer ys y wote neuer
                    wanneThe thryd ys most careI whote noȝt how y schal
                    fare
OxfLinLat129.Note:
Written one couplet per line in the MS; translating Latin ‘Sunt
                        tria vere faciunt me sepe dolere…’, which
                    follows.

YaleBei15.Transcription:
þre ty þynges me cometh a dayþat on ys I haue y noth
                    nere wanneþat þrydde yn ys off michil careþat I schal
                    wony y not nere ware
YaleBei15.Note:
Written as prose; two lines apparently missing (scribe lost place in
                    turning page?).
